subject: Re: [junit] All Methods Public
msgSnippet: So, what s the advantage of having a all-public MyClassHelper when you can turn MyClass methods public? I mean if you re doing this only for testability, why
messageBody:
So, what's the advantage of having a all-public MyClassHelper when you can
turn MyClass' methods public? I mean if you're doing this only for
testability, why not to simply turn the private methods of a class into
protected or package visible?

- Yagiz Erkan -
http://blog.decaresystems.ie


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
